speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: SCENE VII. The gates of Corioli.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: TITUS LARTIUS, having set a guard upon  Corioli, going with drum and trumpet toward  COMINIUS and CAIUS MARCIUS, enters with Lieutenant, other Soldiers, and a Scout

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: So, let the ports be guarded: keep your duties,

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: As I have set them down. If I do send, dispatch

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: Those centuries to our aid: the rest will serve

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: For a short holding: if we lose the field,

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: Hence, and shut your gates upon's.

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: Our guider, come; to the Roman camp conduct us.
